meanings.definition: A group of words containing a subject and predicate, typically forming part of a sentence.
meanings.sent1: The first clause in the story described the main character.
meanings.sent2: She struggled to understand the clause at the beginning of the paragraph.
meanings.sent3: The clause about eating only vegetables made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: In the clause of friendship, trust is the key ingredient.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a funny voice to explain the clause to the class.

meanings.definition: A particular stipulation or provision in a document or agreement.
meanings.sent1: The rental agreement included a clause about noise levels after 10 pm.
meanings.sent2: He carefully reviewed each clause in the contract before signing.
meanings.sent3: The clause stating no pets allowed surprised the new tenant.
meanings.sent4: The clause on confidentiality was crucial for the success of the project.
meanings.sent5: She highlighted the most important clause in the legal document.
